Detailed Description

This file is a template for the executive-config.h file that each application that uses the simple exec must provide. Each application should have an executive-config.h file in a directory named 'config'. If the application uses other components, config files for those components should be placed in the config directory as well. The macros defined in this file control the configuration and functionality provided by the simple executive. Available macros are commented out and documented in this file.

Define Documentation

#define CVMX_CONFIG_ENABLE_DEBUG_PRINTS   1

Enable debug and informational printfs.

#define CVMX_CONFIG_NULL_POINTER_PROTECT   1

Enable setting up of TLB entries to trap NULL pointer references.

#define CVMX_DEBUG_ATTACH   1

Allow attaching of the debugger to UART 1 or PCI debugging even when -debug is not supplied on the boot line.

#define CVMX_ENABLE_DFA_FUNCTIONS

Define to enable the use of simple executive DFA functions.

#define CVMX_ENABLE_HELPER_FUNCTIONS

Define to enable the use of simple executive helper functions.

These include many harware setup functions. See cvmx-helper.[ch] for details.

#define CVMX_ENABLE_LEN_M8_FIX   1

Enable the fix for PKI-100 errata ("Size field is 8 too large in WQE and next pointers").

If CVMX_ENABLE_LEN_M8_FIX is set to 0, the fix for this errata will not be enabled. 0: Fix is not enabled 1: Fix is enabled, if supported by hardware

#define CVMX_ENABLE_PKO_LOCKLESS_OPERATION   1

Configure PKO to use per-core queues (PKO lockless operation).

Please see the related SDK documentation for PKO that illustrates how to enable and configure this option.

#define CVMX_ENABLE_TIMER_FUNCTIONS

Define to enable the use of simple executive timer bucket functions.

Refer to cvmx-tim.[ch] for more information

#define CVMX_ENABLE_ZIP_FUNCTIONS

Define to enable the use of simple executive zip functions.

Refer to cvmx-zip.[ch] for more information

#define CVMX_HELPER_DISABLE_RGMII_BACKPRESSURE   1

Force backpressure to be disabled.

This overrides all other backpressure configuration

#define CVMX_HELPER_DISABLE_SPI4000_BACKPRESSURE   1

Disable the SPI4000's processing of backpressure packets and backpressure generation.

When this is 1, the SPI4000 will not stop sending packets when receiving backpressure. It will also not generate backpressure packets when its internal FIFOs are full.

#define CVMX_HELPER_ENABLE_IPD   1

CVMX_HELPER_ENABLE_IPD controls if the IPD is enabled in the helper function.

Once it is enabled the hardware starts accepting packets. You might want to skip the IPD enable if configuration changes are need from the default helper setup. If necessary, override the default here

#define CVMX_HELPER_FIRST_MBUFF_SKIP   184

CVMX_HELPER_FIRST_MBUFF_SKIP is the number of bytes to reserve before the beginning of the packet.

If necessary, override the default here. See the IPD section of the hardware manual for MBUFF SKIP details.

#define CVMX_HELPER_ILK_CHAN_INTERFACE0   8

Configure ILK channel for each interface.

#define CVMX_HELPER_ILK_CHAN_INTERFACE1   8
#define CVMX_HELPER_ILK_INTF_MASK_INTERFACE0   0x0f

Configure ILK lane mask for each interface (CN68XX,CN78XX).

#define CVMX_HELPER_ILK_INTF_MASK_INTERFACE1   0xf0
#define CVMX_HELPER_ILK_LA_MODE_CAL_ENABLE_INTERFACE0   0

Enable the RX calendar for ILK LA mode NOTE: This is only available for CN68XX pass 2.0 and in pass 2.0 there is a bug where if the CN68XX is connected to another CN68XX that the calendar can only be enabled on one end or on neither end.

If enabled for both sides of the connection then traffic will not flow.

#define CVMX_HELPER_ILK_LA_MODE_CAL_ENABLE_INTERFACE1   0
#define CVMX_HELPER_ILK_LA_MODE_INTERFACE0   0

Configure ILK interface to work in look-aside mode.

Note that this is only available for 68XX pass 2.0 and later.

#define CVMX_HELPER_ILK_LA_MODE_INTERFACE1   0
#define CVMX_HELPER_INPUT_PORT_SKIP_MODE   CVMX_PIP_PORT_CFG_MODE_SKIPL2

Select skip mode for input ports.

#define CVMX_HELPER_INPUT_TAG_INPUT_PORT   1
#define CVMX_HELPER_INPUT_TAG_IPV4_DST_IP   0
#define CVMX_HELPER_INPUT_TAG_IPV4_DST_PORT   0
#define CVMX_HELPER_INPUT_TAG_IPV4_PROTOCOL   0
#define CVMX_HELPER_INPUT_TAG_IPV4_SRC_IP   0
#define CVMX_HELPER_INPUT_TAG_IPV4_SRC_PORT   0
#define CVMX_HELPER_INPUT_TAG_IPV6_DST_IP   0
#define CVMX_HELPER_INPUT_TAG_IPV6_DST_PORT   0
#define CVMX_HELPER_INPUT_TAG_IPV6_NEXT_HEADER   0
#define CVMX_HELPER_INPUT_TAG_IPV6_SRC_IP   0

The following select which fields are used by the PIP to generate the tag on INPUT 0: don't include 1: include.

#define CVMX_HELPER_INPUT_TAG_IPV6_SRC_PORT   0
#define CVMX_HELPER_INPUT_TAG_TYPE   CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_ORDERED

CVMX_HELPER_INPUT_TAG_TYPE selects the type of tag that the IPD assigns to incoming packets.

#define CVMX_HELPER_IPD_DRAM_MODE   CVMX_IPD_OPC_MODE_STT

Select IPD cache mode, default to get all blocks from DRAM (not cached in L2).

#define CVMX_HELPER_NOT_FIRST_MBUFF_SKIP   0

CVMX_HELPER_NOT_FIRST_MBUFF_SKIP is the number of bytes to reserve in each chained packet element.

If necessary, override the default here

#define CVMX_HELPER_NPI_MAX_PIPES   32

Configure number of pipes the SLI/DPI supports, only available in ebb6800.

The SLI/DPI can support upto 32 pipes assigned to packet-rings 0 - 31.

#define CVMX_HELPER_PKO_MAX_PORTS_INTERFACE0   8
#define CVMX_HELPER_PKO_MAX_PORTS_INTERFACE1   8
#define CVMX_HELPER_PKO_QUEUES_PER_PORT_INTERFACE0   4

Define the number of queues per output port.

#define CVMX_HELPER_PKO_QUEUES_PER_PORT_INTERFACE1   1
#define CVMX_HELPER_PKO_QUEUES_PER_PORT_INTERFACE2   1
#define CVMX_HELPER_PKO_QUEUES_PER_PORT_INTERFACE3   1
#define CVMX_HELPER_PKO_QUEUES_PER_PORT_INTERFACE4   1
#define CVMX_HELPER_PKO_QUEUES_PER_PORT_INTERFACE5   1
#define CVMX_HELPER_QOS_PER_PORT_INTERFACE0   false
#define CVMX_HELPER_QOS_PER_PORT_INTERFACE1   false
#define CVMX_HELPER_QOS_PER_PORT_INTERFACE2   false
#define CVMX_HELPER_QOS_PER_PORT_INTERFACE3   false
#define CVMX_HELPER_QOS_PER_PORT_INTERFACE4   false
#define CVMX_HELPER_QOS_PER_PORT_INTERFACE5   false
#define CVMX_HELPER_SPI_TIMEOUT   10

CVMX_HELPER_SPI_TIMEOUT is used to determine how long the SPI initialization routines wait for SPI training.

You can override the value using executive-config.h if necessary

#define CVMX_LLM_CONFIG_NUM_PORTS   2

Select the number of low latency memory ports (interfaces) that will be configured.

Valid values are 1 and 2.
